thatIsImportantText: That is important, because it proofs that the content has not been tampered with and can be trusted.
contentChangedAfterTimestamp: The content was modified after its fingerprint was last added to a public blockchain.
whatIsTimestamp: The fingerprint of this webpage has been published to the blockchain, a public ledger that can’t be changed. This is what is called a “timestamp”.
withTimestampYouCan: With this timestamp, you can verify when and how the website changed its content over time. Websites that timestamp their content stand for more transparency and accountability, which ultimately leads to a more trustworthy internet.
